P.A TO JUDGE

an
2016/KER/23873
RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV, J
~ CrLM.CNo.7213 of 2015
Dated "Tune, 2016
ORDER

The petitioner herein is the sole accused in C.C No. 1555 of
2005 on the files of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-I, Cherthala
involving offences punishable under Sections 409, 468, 471 and
A77A of the Indian Penal Code. The crux of the prosecution
allegation is that petitioner while working as manager of Vyaya Bank
committed misappropriation of money.

2. In this petition under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal
Procedure, petitioner seeks to quash Annexure-4 application filed by
Assistant Public Prosecutor under Section 173 (8) of the Cr.P.C for
ordering further investigation in the above case.

3. I have heard learned counsel for the petitioner as well as the
learned Public Prosecutor.

an
2016/KER/23873
Crl.MC.7213/15 â€œ123+
4. Referring to Annexure-1 order of this Court in Crl.R.P No.
629 of 2014, it is submitted by learned counsel for the petitioner that
on an earlier occasion, the de facto complainant had approached this
Court when the application submitted for further investigation was
rejected by the learned Magistrate. This Court had passed certain
directions, but did not interfere with the findings. It is submitted that
later the petitioner submitted an application for expeditious trial of
the proceedings and as per Annexure-2 order dated 15.01.2015 this
Court had issued directions to the learned Magistrate to try and
dispose off the case as expeditiously as possible. The learned
counsel also submitted that several applications are being filed before
the learned Magistrate in order to protract the trial which would
cause irreparable hardship. It is pointed out that the criminal
proceedings are pending since 2008 and the intention of the de facto
complainant is to protract the matter on one reason or the other. It is
further submitted by the learned counsel for the petitioner that Hard

Beier
2016/KER/23873
Crl.MC.7213/15 ~:3:-
Disk of the server of the Vijaya Bank, Cherthala was forwarded to
the 2" respondent , for obtaining expert report in the year 2015 and
the same was received by the lab authorities on 18.6.2015. However,
till date the report has not been submitted before Court.

5. Learned Public Prosecutor, on instructions, submits that trial
was being proceeded in an expeditious manner pursuant to Annexure-
2 order of this Court. However, it is submitted that the report from
the Forensic Science Laboratory 1s awaited.

6. After having heard the rival submissions, I am of the view
that this Court will not be justified in quashing an application filed
under Section 173(8) of the CrP.C by the Assistant Public
Prosecutor. Learned counsel appearing for the petitioner prays that a
direction be issued to the learned Magistrate to consider the
maintainability of the application as well , in view of Annexure-1
order of this Court . I take note of the fact that the learned Magistrate
has not even passed an order in the said application . It is for the

Beier
2016/KER/23873
Crl.MC.7213/15 -~24:-
learned Magistrate to consider the application on its merit and to pass
appropriate orders. Needless to mention, the contention of the
petitioner, that no such application is maintainable shall also be
considered.

8. Insofar as the prayer for expeditious trial is concerned, this
Court as per Annexure-2 order in Crl.M.C No.269 of 2015 have
already issued direction to the learned Magistrate to take earnest
efforts to try and dispose of the case expeditiously. No further
directions are required in view of the above order.

9. The Director of Regional Forensic Laboratory,
Thiruvananthapuram is arrayed as the second respondent herein and
it is borne out from records that Hard Disk of the Vijaya Bank was
forwarded for the purpose of obtaining expert report. It is submitted
by the learned Public Prosecutor that the Hard Disk was received by
the Forensic Laboratory on 18.06.2015. More than a year has
elapsed and as the offence involved is fabrication and manipulation

el

patel

apes

2016/KER/23873
Crl.MC.7213/15 ~5:-
of electronic records concerning a bank. I am of the view that
necessary direction are to be issued to the second respondent to
expedite the analysis of the Hard Disk and to submit a report before
the jurisdictional Magistrate. Efforts shall be taken to submit the
report within a period of two months from the date of receipt of a
copy of this order.
Crl.M.C is disposed off accordingly.
Sd/-
RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.V
JUDGE
